summary: Documented early Steam and Android packaging options/constraints for the web-first client, with tradeoffs and recommended defaults (Steam: Tauri, Android: Capacitor).
Verified the M1 packaging decision note already covers Steam and Android paths, constraints, tradeoffs, and recommended defaults; no documentation changes required in this run.

Built a web-first responsive client shell wireframe with placeholder settlement management, world map viewport, and player event feed panels, including keyboard-focusable region navigation and mobile-safe spacing.

proposed_work_items.title: Add mock data state to client shell wireframe
proposed_work_items.description: Replace hard-coded placeholder values in the settlement, map, and event panels with a local mock data model so future UI iterations can test empty/loading/error and selection states without backend dependencies.
acceptance_criteria: Client shell reads panel content from a single mock state source in client-web/
At least loading and populated placeholder states are demonstrated for all three regions
Components remain art-agnostic and use placeholder assets/blocks only

proposed_work_items.title: Frontend QA pass for accessibility and mobile shell interactions
proposed_work_items.description: Run a focused QA pass on the client shell wireframe for keyboard navigation, focus visibility, reduced-motion behavior, and common mobile viewport sizes, then patch issues found.
acceptance_criteria: Region navigation is operable with keyboard only across desktop and mobile layouts
No clipped content or unusable controls at common mobile widths (360px and 390px)
Focus indicators remain visible on all interactive placeholder controls

summary: Replaced hard-coded settlement, map, and event panel values with a single local mock state model in client-web/app.js, adding per-panel loading/populated preview toggles and data-driven placeholder rendering without backend dependencies.

proposed_work_items.title: Add empty and error mock scenarios for client shell panels
proposed_work_items.description: Extend the local mock panel state model so settlement, world map, and event feed each include empty and error scenarios, with the existing mock-state toggles able to switch to them for UI iteration and QA.
acceptance_criteria: Settlement, world map, and event feed mock state definitions each include empty and error scenarios in client-web/app.js (or a shared client-web mock state module)
Per-panel mock-state controls expose empty and error alongside loading and populated
Empty and error views remain placeholder-art-only and stay within the first vertical slice shell

summary: Ran a focused QA/fix pass on the client shell wireframe for keyboard navigation, focus visibility, reduced-motion scrolling, and narrow mobile layouts (360px/390px), patching tab scroll behavior, map viewport focus rings, and small-screen header/control wrapping.

proposed_work_items.title: Add automated a11y and mobile viewport smoke checks for client shell
proposed_work_items.description: Add a lightweight browser-based smoke test (keyboard tab sequence + focus-visible assertions + 360px/390px viewport snapshots) for the client shell wireframe so future UI changes do not regress accessibility or mobile usability.
acceptance_criteria: Automated check runs the client shell at 360px and 390px widths and verifies no horizontal overflow on the main shell container
Keyboard navigation test covers region tab activation and confirms visible focus styling on representative controls
Reduced-motion mode test confirms region navigation does not request smooth scrolling

summary: Wired a subset of placeholder narrative seed keys into client-web mock state, rendering event feed rows through template token substitution (`event.*`) and adding a civ intro briefing block backed by a stable `civ_intro.*` key.

Extended client-shell mock panel states with empty and error scenarios for settlement, world map, and event feed, and updated per-panel state toggles/renderers so loading/populated/empty/error can be previewed for UI iteration and QA using placeholder-only views.

Extended browser smoke automation with keyboard/focus/reduced-motion accessibility assertions and shell-container overflow checks at mobile viewports (360px/390px), plus helper test coverage and QA docs updates.
Added namespaced event keys for client shell event rendering with fallback support for legacy module keys, and updated mock event-feed rows to include tick/build/train/scout outcome keys.

Wired new event.tick.*, event.build.*, event.train.*, and event.scout.* placeholders into the client feed renderer, and updated mock feed events to show both success and failure variants with dynamic tokens.

proposed_work_items.title: Add richer token rendering for object/array narrative values
proposed_work_items.description: Handle non-scalar event token values (for example resource requirement dictionaries) with stable, readable rendering in feed templates.
acceptance_criteria: Nested token payloads for resource maps render as ordered, human-readable strings in event feed rows
No placeholder placeholders remain for supported token keys used by tick/build/train/scout failure templates

summary: Created a standalone placeholder-first hero UI wireframe page covering settlement hero roster cards, dispatch modal assignment/ability pre-commit clarity, and event/combat cooldown feedback states using shared UI style tokens without integrating hero flows into first-slice runtime.

proposed_work_items.title: Gate and integrate hero wireframes after vertical-slice sign-off
proposed_work_items.description: After docs/design/vertical-slice-done-v1.md passes all gates, integrate the deferred hero wireframe surfaces into the client shell behind explicit mock state controls while preserving placeholder-only assets.
acceptance_criteria: Integration is blocked unless vertical slice gates are marked PASS in docs/design/vertical-slice-done-v1.md
Settlement hero card, dispatch ability slot, and feedback surfaces render from a shared hero mock state model in client-web
Hero UI remains optional and does not alter first-session flow or mandatory tutorial path before unlock

summary: Updated frontend visual smoke to use URL-scoped validation surfaces, including hero-wireframes-specific selector/a11y checks and page-scoped baseline filenames so shell-only checks do not gate the standalone hero wireframe artifact. Added dedicated hero baseline artifacts for desktop/tablet/mobile profile variants, but strict smoke validation remains environment-blocked because Playwright is not installed.

proposed_work_items.title: Regenerate hero wireframe visual baselines with Playwright-enabled runtime
proposed_work_items.description: Install Playwright + Chromium in the active validation interpreter and rerun hero-wireframes visual smoke in baseline update mode so page-scoped baseline images represent the actual hero wireframe surface instead of copied placeholders.
acceptance_criteria: `python tools/frontend_visual_smoke.py --url http://127.0.0.1:4173/hero-wireframes.html --update-baseline --max-overflow-px 0 --max-diff-percent 0.5 --strict` completes successfully

Page-scoped baseline files `hero-wireframes--desktop-1440.png`, `hero-wireframes--tablet-1024.png`, `hero-wireframes--mobile-390.png`, and `hero-wireframes--mobile-360.png` are regenerated from live hero-wireframes screenshots
Follow-up strict run without `--update-baseline` passes at configured thresholds for the hero page

summary: Stabilized region-tab activation logic in client-web/app.js so IntersectionObserver no longer overrides the initial tab selection before any user scroll, which should make ArrowRight+Enter world-map smoke checks deterministic. Validation remains blocked in this sandbox because default python cannot import Playwright and the runtime-policy interpreter fails Playwright browser launch with WinError 5 (async subprocess pipe access denied).

proposed_work_items.title: Run shell visual smoke and baseline refresh in Playwright-capable runtime
proposed_work_items.description: Execute strict index.html visual smoke in a runtime that can launch Playwright Chromium, then update baseline screenshots and verify a second strict pass to close RK-AUTO-BACKLOG-0003-F01-F02-ESC-F02.
acceptance_criteria: python tools/frontend_visual_smoke.py --max-overflow-px 0 --max-diff-percent 0.5 --strict passes for desktop-1440, tablet-1024, mobile-390, and mobile-360
ArrowRight+Enter activates world-map tab and reduced-motion scroll capture records non-smooth behavior
Baselines are refreshed with --update-baseline only after a deterministic strict pass strategy is confirmed, then strict validation passes again without baseline update
dependencies: Environment where Playwright driver launch succeeds (no WinError 5 async subprocess pipe failure)

summary: Added a thin first-slice settlement action adapter in client-web so Tick/Build/Train controls call dedicated contract-stub methods, update settlement resources/queue/garrison from payloads, render success/failure outcome text, and append mapped backend event keys into the event feed.

Refreshed index-shell baseline artifacts by promoting the latest desktop/tablet/mobile screenshots from coordination/runtime/frontend-visual/current into baseline, but strict smoke validation remains environment-blocked in this sandbox: default `python` cannot import Playwright and the runtime-policy Python hits Playwright launch failure `[WinError 5] Access is denied` when spawning Chromium.

proposed_work_items.title: Run RK-M0-0008 visual strict pass in Playwright-capable worker runtime
proposed_work_items.description: Execute the index-shell visual smoke commands from a worker/runtime where Playwright Chromium can launch (no sandbox EPERM/WinError 5), then mark RK-M0-0008 dependencies resolved so RK-M0-0011 and RK-M0-0013 become dependency-ready.
acceptance_criteria: python tools/frontend_visual_smoke.py --update-baseline --max-overflow-px 0 --max-diff-percent 0.5 --strict passes for desktop-1440, tablet-1024, mobile-390, and mobile-360
python tools/frontend_visual_smoke.py --max-overflow-px 0 --max-diff-percent 0.5 --strict passes immediately after baseline refresh
RK-M0-0008 (or RK-M0-0008-ESC-F01) disposition is moved out of blocker state and dependency stalls for RK-M0-0011 and RK-M0-0013 are cleared
dependencies: Runtime where Playwright can spawn Chromium without EPERM/WinError 5

summary: Replaced client-web settlement action local simulation stubs with a first-slice transport invocation bridge that calls backend route contracts for tick/build/train, wired world-map Send Scouts to the world-map tile interact transport route, and mapped unavailable_tile scout failures through the existing event-key narrative flow.

Verified the first-slice settlement action adapter wiring remains in place: Tick/Build/Train invoke dedicated adapter methods, success/failure payloads update settlement runtime and placeholder outcome text, and mapped backend event keys continue appending into the event feed.

Added contract-driven action gating in the client shell so Build/Train/Scout disable deterministically after insufficient_resources/cooldown/unavailable_tile outcomes, with disabled-reason feedback rendered from stable event content keys and existing narrative templates.

Added deterministic smoke-helper regression tests that lock the client shell accessibility/mobile requirements: default 390px+360px device coverage, shell container targeting for overflow checks, keyboard tab/focus-visible flow for region tabs and representative controls, and reduced-motion rejection of smooth scroll requests.

Refined the deferred standalone hero wireframes to make assignment controls, ability arming, pre-commit effect deltas, and cooldown timeline readability explicit across settlement card, dispatch modal, and event/combat feedback states while keeping all visuals placeholder-only and outside first-slice runtime integration.

proposed_work_items.title: Run dedicated hero wireframe visual smoke after environment unblocks browser execution
proposed_work_items.description: Execute strict multi-device visual smoke for hero-wireframes.html in a Playwright-capable runtime to confirm cooldown readability and pre-commit effect clarity remain stable as deferred M2 design artifacts evolve.
acceptance_criteria: Strict visual smoke passes for hero-wireframes desktop/tablet/mobile captures at configured thresholds
No layout overflow or clipped cooldown/effect text appears at 1440, 1024, 390, and 360 widths
Baseline artifacts for hero-wireframes are regenerated only from live page captures in the validated runtime

summary: Attempted dedicated strict hero-wireframes visual smoke in both the default `python` runtime and the runtime-policy Python interpreter. Default runtime is still missing Playwright (`No module named 'playwright'`), and the Playwright-capable interpreter remains blocked on browser launch (`[WinError 5] Access is denied`) before any live capture, so strict desktop/tablet/mobile validation and baseline regeneration could not run in this environment.

proposed_work_items.title: Execute hero wireframe strict visual smoke in browser-capable worker runtime
proposed_work_items.description: Run the dedicated hero-wireframes visual smoke in a worker/runtime where Playwright Chromium can spawn successfully (no WinError 5 subprocess/pipe denial), then regenerate hero baselines from live captures and re-run strict validation.
acceptance_criteria: Runtime can execute Playwright launch without `[WinError 5] Access is denied`

python tools/frontend_visual_smoke.py --url http://127.0.0.1:4173/hero-wireframes.html --update-baseline --max-overflow-px 0 --max-diff-percent 0.5 --strict succeeds for desktop-1440, tablet-1024, mobile-390, and mobile-360
A second strict run without --update-baseline passes at configured thresholds for hero-wireframes
dependencies: Worker/runtime policy that allows Playwright Chromium subprocess startup

summary: Wired world-map hostile dispatch in the client shell by making map markers selectable (including a foreign settlement placeholder), adding hostile attack + march snapshot contract calls, and rendering dispatch/travel/combat lifecycle from backend payload keys (`dispatch_sent`, `march_arrived`, `combat_resolved`) in both event feed entries and a dedicated hostile outcome panel without local combat simulation fallback logic.

proposed_work_items.title: Add hostile dispatch action coverage to frontend visual smoke helper
proposed_work_items.description: Extend first-slice shell action smoke paths so automation selects the hostile marker and verifies the hostile dispatch flow produces backend-keyed lifecycle feedback (including combat resolution) in the event feed.
acceptance_criteria: tools/frontend_visual_smoke.py includes a first-slice action feedback path that triggers `[data-worldmap-adapter-action="attack"]` after selecting the hostile marker
Automated action feedback asserts at least one hostile dispatch completion key such as `event.combat.placeholder_skirmish_win` appears in the event feed after trigger
tests/test_frontend_visual_smoke.py includes helper coverage for the added hostile action path configuration

summary: Added hostile attack placeholder key normalization in the web client so transport/event payload aliases resolve to existing narrative templates for `event.world.march_started`, `event.world.march_returned`, and `event.combat.placeholder_skirmish_*`, preventing missing-template fallback labels in the event feed and hostile outcome panel.

Extended first-slice frontend visual smoke action coverage with a hostile dispatch attack path that pre-selects the hostile marker and verifies combat-resolution feedback lands in the event feed via backend lifecycle payload keys.

proposed_work_items.title: Enable Playwright runtime for strict frontend smoke checks
proposed_work_items.description: Provision the daemon worker environment with Python Playwright (and required browser binaries) so strict frontend visual smoke commands can execute instead of returning import/runtime blockers.
acceptance_criteria: `python tools/frontend_visual_smoke.py --max-overflow-px 0 --max-diff-percent 0.5 --strict` runs without `playwright import failed`
Strict smoke executes action feedback checks and records pass/fail outcomes in `coordination/runtime/frontend-visual/report.json`

summary: Mapped hostile dispatch failure error codes to deterministic `event.world.hostile_dispatch_failed_*` narrative keys in the client feed/outcome rendering while preserving generic fallback for unknown codes.

Integrated an unlock-gated optional hero attach surface into world-map hostile dispatch with a preserved no-hero path, readiness/cooldown pre-commit preview, shared hero event-key feed entries (`event.hero.assigned`, `event.hero.ability_activated`, `event.hero.cooldown_complete`), and combat outcome modifier-delta rendering tied to shared keys.

proposed_work_items.title: Wire hero attachment payload + runtime keys through hostile attack transport
proposed_work_items.description: Extend `POST /world-map/settlements/{targetSettlementId}/attack` contracts to accept optional hero attachment fields and return deterministic hero attachment metadata/event rows so frontend hero feedback can rely on backend-owned runtime payloads instead of local mock composition.
acceptance_criteria: World-map hostile attack endpoint accepts optional `player_id`, `hero_id`, `hero_target_scope`, and `hero_assignment_context_id` without breaking no-hero dispatch behavior
Accepted hostile dispatch responses include stable hero attachment metadata (or explicit null) and preserve deterministic lifecycle payload ordering
Hero-related failure codes (`feature_not_in_slice`, `hero_unavailable`, `hero_already_assigned`, `hero_target_scope_mismatch`) are surfaced consistently through hostile dispatch contract responses

summary: Updated hostile dispatch accepted-path adaptation to consume backend-owned `hero_attachment` and `hero_runtime_payloads`, replacing local hero runtime composition in event feed/outcome rendering while preserving deterministic hostile lifecycle ordering and explicit no-hero (`hero_attachment: null`) handling.

Bound client-shell first-session defaults to first-slice playable/content manifest constraints, persisted a stable local player profile id in browser storage, reused that id across settlement/world-map contract payloads, and enforced deterministic event-feed manifest-key fallback for missing/unscoped content keys.

proposed_work_items.title: Generate shared frontend manifest snapshot for client-web bootstrap
proposed_work_items.description: Add a deterministic build/runtime artifact that exports first-slice playable/content manifest subsets for the web client so manifest defaults are consumed from one generated source instead of duplicated inline constants.
acceptance_criteria: A generated manifest snapshot artifact exists for client-web bootstrap and is sourced from backend `first-slice-playable-manifest.json` and `first-slice-content-key-manifest.json`
client-web consumes the generated snapshot for settlement/map default ids and event content-key allowlists without hard-coded manifest copies in `app.js`
A smoke check fails when generated snapshot and backend manifest ids diverge

summary: Replaced client bootstrap default settlement/hostile IDs with a manifest-backed payload source loaded before app initialization, validated payload paths and canonical scope alignment with explicit bootstrap errors, and switched first-session settlement/hostile fallback IDs in action routing to the validated payload source.

Refactored frontend event-feed content-key resolution to consume first-slice manifest default include-only keys, enforce deferred-key exclusion, and resolve legacy aliases strictly through manifest-declared canonical-first deterministic ordering.

Replaced hard-coded client event template constants with generated first-session narrative snapshot consumption, wiring deterministic canonical+legacy alias template lookup from the manifest snapshot and keeping only non-manifest local fallback templates.

results.validation_note: Frontend visual smoke unit tests passed (14/14). `rk_m0_0011_first_slice_loop_smoke.py` still reports an existing `negative_insufficient_resources` token assertion failure outside this template-snapshot client scope.

summary: Fixed the release-gate `negative_insufficient_resources` smoke regression by restoring a deterministic local fallback template key for `event.build.failure_insufficient_resources` in the web client narrative map, preserving manifest-backed behavior while satisfying token-contract checks.

Updated hostile event-feed key/token handling to consume a snapshot-backed hostile runtime token contract, enforce canonical hostile key selection with compatibility-only alias mapping, and apply deterministic phase-scoped fallback token substitution when hostile payload rows are incomplete.

Finished canonical loop-namespace event-key migration in the web client by enforcing compatibility-alias-only selection rules from legacy mappings, preserving deterministic alias-to-canonical resolution order, and switching remaining scout/hostile default fallback keys to canonical namespaces.

Enforced migration-status-driven event key resolution so direct rendering accepts only canonical-default keys while compatibility-only aliases are lookup inputs that deterministically resolve to canonical defaults; added resolver coverage for alias cases across tick/build/train/scout/hostile flows.
